texts:
Thanks for replying 💪

I hope you're well! I'm looking for a Data Engineer with expertise in Python and Snowflake for a full-time remote role in a US client (PST overlap). A good conversational level of English is required. 

Key responsibilities include designing automated data solutions and maintaining applications. Client requested at least 2 to 3 years of experience using Snowflake. Aside from that main expectations are related to software development with strong skills in data manipulation and database handling (JD Annexed or I can copy & paste here for you)

This is a contractor role, with a max payrate around 7.2K.

Let me know if you are interested. If so, I have to ask you just one follow up question before setting the interview 😊

Waiting on your answer,

Best regards,

That's great to hear 😎

In the interest of time, I created a very concise and direct G. Form a couple questions related specifically about the main key skills that the client is looking for. Would you be comfortable to do that before the interview with me? Or do you prefer to do the interview first? 

Either case, that information is the one that I need to pass along to the Technical Matcher of this role.

What do you prefer? 

-- If you want to fill the form first and check if you are a match, you can use this link:

https://forms.gle/RpqRbPJFwWAmW3zW6			

-- If you want to schedule a sync first, you can use this link:

https://calendly.com/paulo-teamtorc/15min

Thanks for getting back to me! 💪

Hope you're well! I'm reaching out about a User Interface Designer role for Rockwell Automation in Medellín. Since I don’t usually work in this area, apologies if the role doesn’t fully align with your skill set 😅

They’re looking for someone experienced in visual design, design systems, illustration, or interaction design—a focus on one or two of these areas works. 

Some understanding of front-end frameworks (like Angular, React) is also ideal. You don’t need to be a developer, just familiar with how it all connects.

This is a contract role with a hybrid schedule (in-office at least once a week) at a rate of up to $4.3K/month USD. It’s an initial 6-month contract with a renewal in mind at the end.

Let me know if you’re interested! If so, I have just one quick follow-up question before we set up the interview 😊

Looking forward to hearing from you,

Best regards,

That's great to hear 😎

In the interest of time, I created a very concise and direct G. Form with 4 questions related specifically about the main key skills that the client is looking for.

Would you be comfortable to do that before the interview with me? Or do you prefer to do the interview first?

Either case, that information is the one that I need to pass along to the Technical Matcher of this role.

What do you prefer?

-- If you want to fill the form first and check if you are a match, you can use this link:

https://forms.gle/1Y8dJyzdFrCWMoEA7

-- If you want to schedule a sync first, you can use this link:

https://calendly.com/paulo-teamtorc/15min


Let me know what you find it is best at this point 😁

Thanks for getting back to me! 💪

Hope you're doing well! I’m reaching out about an SAP Engineer role with Lenovo in Monterrey, Mexico. Since SAP roles can vary a lot, I apologize in advance if the position doesn’t align perfectly with your background, these SAP Modules can be a bit overwhelming for someone who is not from the area😅

They’re looking for someone with at least 1+ year of hands-on experience in SAP ECC or S/4 SD modules, ideally within supply chain functions. Experience with troubleshooting and diagnosing system issues, as well as contributing to project implementations or system maintenance, is a key focus for this role.

This is a Direct hire, EOR Contract with Lenovo. Max monthly rate for this role is around 4.6K USD + Local benefits.

The role is on-site, based in Monterrey, and offers an opportunity to work with a dedicated team on enhancing SAP system reliability and efficiency. 

Let me know if you’re interested! If so, I have just one quick follow-up question before we set up the interview 😊

Looking forward to hearing from you,

Best regards

That's great to hear 😎

In the interest of time, I created a very concise and direct G. Form with 3 questions related specifically about the main key skills that the client is looking for. Would you be comfortable to do that before the interview with me? Or do you prefer to do the interview first?

Either case, that information is the one that I need to pass along to the Technical Matcher of this role.

What do you prefer?

-- If you want to fill the form first and check if you are a match, you can use this link:

https://forms.gle/KWaiacnybBN94vT37

-- If you want to schedule a sync first, you can use this link:

https://calendly.com/paulo-teamtorc/15min

Let me know what you find it is best at this stage 😁

No problem!
15
In case you hear about anyone in your network who might be willing to take on a new challenge, here's the Job Description. It is basically an opportunity to join Lenovo's team, in Monterrey region, as a direct EOR contract (Hybrid role). The focus is on SAP ECC or S/4 SD Modules. Rate should be around 4.6K USD + Local benefits.

Thanks!

I see that you weren't interested. No problem, I appreciate that you took some time to reply to my first message and wish you a very nice week ahead. Maybe we can catch up in the future for another position, see you then!

Yeah, that's how decided to go for this one. Usually, they tend to do these short-term contracts to check if the professional is really what they are looking for - as sometimes, they invest a lot of time & money to hire, and it turns out it is not a good professional. 

But I totally understand your side, this kind of short-term contracts doesn't give the idea of stability. 

Thanks for replying and if you know someone who might be interested, let me know 💪

No problem and apologize sending you a message even through you are not a fit. It is the first time that I work in a position related to a specific SAP module, and I'm trying to nail the best Boolean search for it yet. 

If you happen to know anyone in your network who might be a better match, feel free to send them my way!

Thanks!

Hey {firstName}! 

So, the position that I was going to send you is a UI Designer role. Problem is: I've been told recently that the client now has requested candidates with at least 4 years of experience as a UI Designer... Not sure if you fit this one, but I'm going to also attach the job description here. Let me know what you think, thanks!

The key updates are as follows:

- MDM-related experience is now a plus.
- Java has been added as an alternative to Python.
- AWS is now mandatory.

They’re also emphasizing development experience over "pure QA." While QAs aren’t excluded, the focus is shifting toward candidates with skills typically associated with an SDET.

Here’s the full job description for your reference—let me know your thoughts! 😎😊

Hey!

So, should we proceed, or let this one pass for now? If it is not within your technical profile, I apologize, I'm trying my best to create a Boolean search that will filter out other positions, but sometimes it still gets caught. 

If you do know someone who might be a good fit and is interested, you can also send him/her in my way.

Appreciate the consideration you had to reply to my first message, have a great week ahead!

Opa, tudo bem?

Para essa vaga, infelizmente é beeem preciso 😓

Eu reparei que muitos dos profissionais que eu contato aqui no Brasil, para vagas fora, geralmente tem um entrave nessa parte do Inglês. Antes, eu apenas respondia que "assim que tiver melhor no inglês, fala comigo", mas isso não servia de muita ajuda. 

Daí, eu hoje sempre recomendo dois caminhos concretos, que podem ajudar: Escolas de inglês como a Cambly, ou uma mentoria mais individual. 

Nessa segunda opção, eu pessoalmente busquei um bom tutor/professor de inglês que eu pudesse indicar. Participei de uma das aulas do Marcelo, e gostei bastante, são bem voltadas a conversação. Vou deixar o contato. Não precisa falar que fui eu que indiquei, não tô buscando nenhum tipo de ganho com essa indicação.

Forte abraço, e sim, se tu tiveres afiado no inglês mais para frente, me procura que a gente dá uma olhada no mercado pra você.

Abraço!

https://www.linkedin.com/in/marcelo-dos-santos-lima/
+55 11 95109-6468
